channel.title: News from Faculty of Engineering:any category
channel.description: Latest news from Faculty of Engineering:any category

item.title: Graduate changed by disaster research
item.description: Alice Yan Chang-Richards’ disaster-related postgraduate research has had a lasting effect on her life.

item.title: Can I borrow your notes?
item.description: Notable - an internet note taking application launched by fourth year Software Engineering students.

item.title: RINA awards recognise Yacht Research Unit
item.description: Professor Richard Flay receives two awards from Royal Institute of Naval Architects.

item.title: Technology to help New Zealand’s dairy and aquaculture sectors
item.description: A major Faculty of Engineering research project is developing new sensing technology designed to increase the productivity and profitability of the dairy and aquaculture industries.

item.title: AUEA Braithwaite-Thompson Graduate Research Award for 2012
item.description: The AUEA Braithwaite-Thompson graduate scholarship is awarded annually to an international student studying a Master of Engineering, Master of Operations Research or a Doctorate in The Faculty of Engineering.

item.title: Engineering staff win prestigious 2012 Best Transactions Paper award
item.description: A/Prof Valeriy Vyatkin and Dr Nirmal Nair from the Department of Electrical & Computer Engineering have been recognised by the IEEE Systems, Man and Cybernetics Society.

item.title: Engineering building development update
item.description: Find out how the proposed Newmarket Campus relates to recently announced plans to upgrade Engineering buildings.

item.title: Making the national grid smarter
item.description: The Faculty of Engineering’s Power Systems Group is part of a national research team that is tasked with making the national grid smarter.

item.title: Collaboration has led to roading revolution
item.description: Faculty of Engineering design and expertise could help an Auckland company treble the rate it can apply life-saving rumble strips to busy New Zealand roads.
